text.text: As the name implies, the site is located in the heart of Chennai the hotel is a palatial tribute to Southern India’s greatest empires – the Imperial Cholas. There are four separate entry points, each with its distinct artistic identity. The hotel welcomes guests in 522 rooms and 78 serviced apartments, each of which is a triumph of design aesthetics. The ten food and beverage outlets bring regional, national and global cuisines to the cognoscenti, No. 63, Mount Road, Guindy, Chennai- 600032, Tamil Nadu, India. Recommended!

editorialSummary.text: Modern quarters in a contemporary hotel with dining options & a bar, plus 2 pools & a spa.

text.text:
5/5. Great stay really. It’s a 5 star hotel and does deserve it. Great food. Great location. Good alcohol availability. Service 4-5*. Extremely clean and amenities all very well looked after. You get what you pay for it. Its value is pretty good. Your not overpaying and price point was less than I expected.

It was let down a little by tiny issues with room availability at the start. Sometimes things weren’t made obvious to us. But honestly this was down to the cyclone and language/culture barriers.

editorialSummary.text: Relaxed beachfront lodging offering a restaurant & a bar, plus 2 outdoor pools & free breakfast.

text.text:
I booked for a dayout on my son's first birthday with my family. It costs around 1900 per head including food,pool and some indoor and outdoor activities. Pool is good and I have not accessed indoor and outdoor games. Food is very average, soup and starters are very cold. Even buffet cutlery were not provided properly. I would suggest to improve the quality of food in buffet and apart from that the staffs and reception persons were kind and helpful.
Thank you

text.text:
Don't spoil your weekend by booking room here.

We came here for a weekend at 1:15 PM after booking the room via Agoda. Their CheckIn time is 2 PM. But they cannot allot room for us till 4 PM and still a lot of people were waiting for the room to be allotted.

Whenever we ask, we get a standard reply that "Room will be cleaned in 10 minutes and you can get the key"

Finally we cancelled the booking and left.

Note: The swimming pool is too small and crowdy. People came for external events also can use(not restricted only for Resort Guests)

text.text: If you are looking for a clean restaurant with good food,you might want to try out this place. It is one of the best South and North Indian pure vegetarian restaurants in the area, and it offers a variety of dishes to suit your taste buds. Whether you crave for a spicy sambar, which is very delicious by the way, or a mild jain food, you will find something to satisfy your appetite here. The cost of the food is a bit more than average, but it is worth it for the quality and quantity. The service is fast and efficient, and the place is quite clean despite having so many customers. It is a lovely place to have family time and enjoy a hearty meal. You will not regret visiting this restaurant.

text.text: I recently dined at this beautiful and elegant restaurant, captivated by its stunning ambiance. The food was truly amazing, showcasing a delightful blend of flavors and impeccable presentation. The drinks were impressive, though the limited options for cocktails and wines left room for improvement. The service, while good, could benefit from a more attentive touch to enhance the overall dining experience.

text.text:
Madras square is an absolute gem when it comes to finding a perfect dining spot for any occasion. Whether it's a family dinner, a meet-up with friends, or a romantic date with your partner, this restaurant offers an ambiance that caters to all. The moment you step inside, you are greeted with warm lighting, cozy seating, and an overall welcoming atmosphere. The interior design strikes a balance between modern elegance and a touch of rustic charm. Soft jazz music playing in the background adds to the soothing ambiance, allowing for easy conversation and a relaxed dining experience. The choice of comfortable seating arrangements, including booths for intimate dinners and larger tables for groups, ensures that every guest feels at ease. The restaurant's dimly lit setting and well-thought-out decor create an inviting, romantic atmosphere that's perfect for couples, while still remaining family-friendly and suitable for gatherings with friends.
The service is nothing short of exceptional. From the moment you are seated, the staff is attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely interested in making your dining experience memorable. They strike the perfect balance between being attentive without being intrusive, ensuring that your needs are met promptly. The staff's warm and friendly demeanor added a personal touch to the evening, making us feel like valued guests.

Now, let's talk about the highlight of madras square, the food. The menu boasts a diverse selection of dishes that cater to various tastes and dietary preferences. Each dish is carefully crafted with attention to detail and presentation, resulting in a culinary delight.

text.text:
This is my go to place for buffet whenever I am in Chennai and this place never disappoints.

The atmosphere is quite vibrant and lively , the quirky decor and the entire setup is amazing.

The staff at this place is what stands out for me . They are extremely hospitable and courteous and always checking up on you and your dining experience.

The buffet menu offers a lot of options along with the live counter that you are spoilt for choices .
However I think they can improve the taste and quality of some of the kebabs, that will only elevate the entire flavor and experience.

They prefer you reserve your spot by phone or online so make sure to do that .

I would like to highlight a few points about this Velachery

Ambience :
Worst ambience, bad smell as soon as we enter into the restaurant.

Hygiene :

Food :
You can see the dirty and sticky plates not at all cleaned up properly. Lost the interest to eat after taking the plates and utensils.

All the BBQ's were burnt too much, not at all kids friendly menu.
The main menu was kept ( buffet ) at a dirt place, all the food became cold.

Price : Too pricey - we were 4 adults(1000+) and two kids (+500/ per kids)

Overall experience : we went to spend time to enjoy our friends birthday but we just wasted our valuable time.

This place had quite the vibe,it is slightly bigger than usual barbeque buffet restaurants and surprisingly all tables were occupied.
The staff were also attentive, although we had a bit of delay on getting our starters refilled at first, but later it became smooth. The welcome drink was also quite good. The staff doesnt come and ask you too many questions in between having food, they ask just the basic questions like spice level and quality, which is good .
Coming to the food, we started with soup , the usual starters and barbeques. Special mention to their mutton seekh kebab which was exceptional.
The main cource was a bit disapointing, with only a few options. The taste was also average, but i guess that is fine coz we were already full with the starters. The dessert was the best part. There were a few things which was quite new for us. The live counter was also good, with pizza , chat, pasta , dosa etc.
Overall, it is a good place, but if you ask me to choose between bbq nation and coal barbeques, i would pick bbq nation. I think maybe in the near future this place will come up to that level.

text.text:
I recently visited Erode Amman Mess in Adyar after seeing a viral Instagram reel featuring celebrity-endorsed dishes. Despite my initial excitement, the experience was disappointingly subpar. The restaurant, situated in the basement, had 2 designated parking space infront of the adjacent building directed by the security guard.

Opting for the recommended Japan Chicken, Chicken Biryani, and Porotta, I anticipated savoring delightful flavors. However, the Japan Chicken, though visually appealing, tasted stale, with improperly cooked chicken leaving a raw meat aftertaste. The portion seemed suitable for two people. The Chicken Biryani lacked flavor, was excessively oily, and featured less-than-fresh chicken. Despite battling nausea, I tried the Porotta, which, while below average, fared better than the other dishes.

Despite a clean wash area, the prevalence of negative Google reviews proved accurate. With a bill of 972 rupees for three unsatisfactory dishes, the cost did not align with the low-quality experience. Regrettably, I won't be returning or recommending Erode Amman Mess to others.

text.text:
Got to visit erode Amman mess after a long time yesterday night. Got the table after giving the name in like 10-15 mins. But food was served in like really fast. Ordered Kochi rasam, which was really good for the cold i had. Butter garlic prawns was ordered as starter with some other chicken items, which was really not that great(felt lil yucky - personal opinion). Mutton biriyani was really good(was served piping hot). Erode roti was not that great. Wheat parotta was good, with paneer butter masala(nice). Egg dosas were really good. Kalakki was Superb. Restaurant service was really good, with everyone tending to our orders really fast. Couldn’t get Elaneer payasam, as it got over.

Now the bad part. I had parked the car by myself with security helping with instructions in-front of the building in the corner. When I was about to get into the car after dinner, he started to ask for tips very rudely. I got irritated and moved the car towards the front of the restaurant for others to enter the car. So I had to wait like 5 mins. He came near the passenger door and was looking at us the entire time, and was telling something bad about tips to another person. People give tips by themselves for wallet parking or good service without asking. But this was like very unpleasant. Restaurant management should look into this.

text.text:
Food:
Kozhi rasam - Pretty watery but rich in fragrance, and flavours; mild-spiced, and the after-effect from a gulp hit slow and steady, TOO GOOD 🤩

Japan chicken - Renowned dish which is similar to Mac and cheese but instead it was chicken and cheese; ain't spicy at all and it was sweet from the watery gravy, very tender BL meat, a bit Tangy but still enjoyable 👌

EAM Veg Meals with Annur Mutton Kuzhambu - A full meal with poriyal, kootu on a banana leaf, now that is a platter!!
Hands down, their paruppu podi is the BEST EVER; with the ghee and their potato poriyal, this was HEAVENLY!!
Their mutton gravy was exquisite!! That delicious Kongu taste in every scoop, moderate spice level, Very tender meat, yeh dil maange more!! To sum up with were their Curd, buttermilk, and gulkand, A PROPER MEAL!! 🥰

Chicken biryani - The seeraga samba rice was scraped from the vessel so was a bit burnt; the meat pieces were well cooked, succulent and with the Japan chicken gravy, this was a different combination 😊

Mutton kothu parotta - WHAT-A-WOW!! So damn tender mutton chopped to bite-sized pieces and minced very well with the soft parotta!! Spicy pepper with kongu masala and the chill flavour from the gravy, OH WOW, Amazing aroma, this was pretty spicy and AWEsome!! 😘😘

Masala kalakki and Chinna vengaya omelet - Their shallots omelet tasted good while the kalakki tasted normal to me with the basic ingredients in any kalakki, GOOD!! 😍

Ambiance/Price:
One of the biggest cons of this place is their parking space and the waiting time for the tables. I had to squeeze my bike in somewhere possible; waited for around half an hour during peak hours even on a weekday and got my seats on a shared table.
But, there was not much of a waiting time for the dishes. It was quick and courteous; not much of an ambiance too, very much like any South Indian hotel.
The prices too were very well within our nominal budget so a good place to try out their signature dishes.

*Personal rating would be a 4.5

text.text:
I was visiting Barbeque restaurant after a long years. I was very eager to experience a magic but what I and my team received was not a Good one. We waited for a while to get the barbequed items on our table. They were missing the items which we ordered to repeat. Food quality is kind of OK. Main dishes, desserts were not much good.

Good thing is they provided offer for Rs.99 if your Birthday occurring on the month. Offered small cake and played Birthday song.

They provided each one to experience Virtual Reality with a VR kit.

The one which was made me upset was the leakage of the roof. The rain was pouring outside and the rain water started to leaking on our table. It should be rectified.

text.text:
TERIBBLE SERVICE AND FOOD: DON’T dare to go.

Visited this place on 27/12/2023

Booked for 8 Pax people 9-11pm slot. Bad service with ultra low quality food. Place is jam packed with very little place to move around, starters served are limited and took a lot time to refill. All the Hindi bhaiyas not understanding anything you ask. Service people is very less to that of dine-in pax.

Desert: Cakes have nothing than whipped cream. Sweets served are not fresh. Icecream tastes very low quality. Gulob jamun is only eatable.

Main-course: Only four main courses are provided: Biryani, Fried rice, Gravy and White rice. Biryani was not even hot and very worst.

Live counters are very slow.

Their Washrooms are horrible as hell with NO WATER AND HIGH ODOUR. No attention is being given towards it even after complaining.

Waste of money 🙅🏻‍♂️🙅🏻‍♂️🙅🏻‍♂️🙅🏻‍♂️🙅🏻‍♂️

text.text: The rooms were very dirty. Not cleaned properly. There was no separate hand towel provided in the bathroom. The maintenance of the place was very very bad. text.text:
I would never expect this kind of experience with a hotel that charges 4-star rates and has hotels all across India. It was the worst from the get-go. It took us 5 phone calls just to book the room because the call centre folks were so confused. Then the hotel wouldn't confirm our booking. The front desk number of the hotel is practically useless because people pick it up and then disconnect immediately. After many calls and finally getting someone to talk to us they confirmed our booking. We also required an airport pickup for which we had already given the details to the call centre and then again we had to provide the details to the hotel. We received an email asking which vehicle we wanted to which we replied. After that no confirmation.

One day before we were due to arrive we tried calling the hotel many times and the one time they picked up they said the cab wasn't not available. We gave up and decided to book an uber but randomly got a call from the driver when we arrived at the airport. Why couldn't they have confirmed the booking and given us the driver details? What if we missed the call or weren't able to get in touch? The hotel front desk number doesn't work anyway.

All this effort, we thought at least the hotel will be good... But we were left disappointed there as well. The AC wasn't working from morning till afternoon anywhere, be it the rooms, the lobby or the cafe. And there was mold and leakage in the rooms. The breakfast was not at all good and they could neither Indian nor continental food right. Luckily our stay was only for a day. I hope this hotel shuts down soon as there is no point of it.

editorialSummary.text: Indian and Chinese food served at a large restaurant with a garden, party lawn and banquet hall.

text.text:
I have been to this place two times. Earlier with friends and we had dinner served in restaurant. This time I went with my family and We opted for vegetarian buffet.
Adults: ₹350 ; kids: ₹250. Food price is very economical as compared to other restaurants on ECR.
Points to improve:
1. Ambience is great but the furniture is old which kills the vibe of this place.
2. Food quality can be improved, the one with we ate felt like Marriage food. Ice cream was simple vanilla with no options. Management can increase the price but give great quality food because the place is great and people would love to come here for food.
3. Buffet menu can be made better and with more options. I felt too much oil in cauliflower (could be just me but I felt it)

Is not all bad, place is great for photo lovers and there a small park for kids but be careful during night time as there are lot of plants and there can be insects or anything.

Overall, nice ambience and with slight quality improvement in food it can become a great hanging out place.

Any questions please free free to ask.

Thanks!

text.text: Reserved for a weekend staycation. A little within the city but once we entered, it didn’t feel like it. It’s clean, there’s privacy and a much needed calm environment. Good place to unwind. We had a pleasant stay with great food and polite staff. Couldn’t ask for more.

originalText.text: Reserved for a weekend staycation. A little within the city but once we entered, it didn’t feel like it. It’s clean, there’s privacy and a much needed calm environment. Good place to unwind. We had a pleasant stay with great food and polite staff. Couldn’t ask for more.

text.text: It is a small resort. It has a clean swimming pool, large grass lawn and both are occupied by the people of events that are coducted here. So people who stay here can play outdoor games only in early morning. There are plants and trees all around. Other than the swimming pool and a lawn nothing else is there to qualify this as resort because the resort is very very small in area where you could reach the end of resort from enterance within 3 minutes on foot. Huge parkimg area.  Clean and comfortable rooms with all features. Wonderful luxury rooms. But no innovative features matching vgp. Ideal TTDC etc. In VGP there is a open shower, open bath tub with very large rooms for slightly lesser price. In the morning if you wake up and open the window it is like we are in a hill station with all green trees and sea breeze as per its name Green Meadows . Very pleasant and refreshing moments in all 21 hours we stay. Food price is a scam and we do not know the exact price until we are billed with service charges and taxes. But the food is good except shawarma. 5 star service by people at hotel whether its room delivery or having food at hotel. I felt at home having food here. Food here is nothing Ketala and not even Indian as I could not understand the food by its name in menu card at hotel. Me being a pure veg did not have food here aftet seeing the all non veg items but my family cherished food as they are non vegetarians. The complimentary break fast is too good. The resort rate is higher than VGP with limited area and without innovative facility when compated to VGP but having good rating than VGP is because of the services of Alena and her team. I had a very very memorable time here but having seen large resorts with same price for this very very small resort, I still wonder the price

text.text:
I had my own doubts initially while booking like, if the venue space (lawn as well as indoor) would suffice, if the menu would be to everyone's liking, if GM (Green Meadows) people would respond immediately on any exigency, etc., etc.,

Trust me, all these doubts were uncalled for and this is a venue where I could hardly find any deficiency. They offer only the venue and the food; rest all, we need to arrange on our own. Fortunately, our pundit (sastrigal) took care of all the items pertaining to the rituals and the Decor people stepped in and took care of return gift bags and garlands for the occasion. Hence, we had absolutely no hitches at all.

Food was awesome and was well appreciated by the guests. Greeting the guests with starters, snacks, beverages were all well taken care of and no monitoring or follow up was ever required. Even when we had more than anticipated number of guests, they accommodated without a fuss and thanks to the GM team.

Rooms were pretty safe for us and the guests and not even a safety pin was lost. They helped in transporting the luggage from/to our vehicle with their battery vehicle during check-in and check-out. If at all we the hosts, the organisers of the wedding could enjoy the occasion and the delicacies without a wee bit of tension of organising, credit goes to the team, GM.

Sraddha ma'am was easily reachable anytime we had a query. She never lost her cool and explained things to the nicety.  From the time of booking to final settlement, she was very helpful throughout.

I'll recommend Green Meadows to anyone looking to host a wedding or any other event. It's a safe secluded venue free from pollution of any kind with ample parking managed by a great team. Keep up the good  work Team Green Meadows!

*🔥Must Try🔥*

*Special Ghee Dosa was just Wowww🔥🔥
*Ghee Pongal is just another level of happiness for pongal lovers, it is very addictive and yummy 🤤🍚
*Medhu Vada was soft and crispy, just a usual vada
*Banglore Masala Dosa was just usual banglore stuff with lot of potato stuffings👍🏻✌🏼
*Curry Leaf Dosa (or) Karuvepillai Dosa very unique in taste and very crispy!!🤌🏻

~They provide Banglore Sambar and Tamilnadu Sambar, it’s your preference!
~All the chutney’s were just amazing in taste and touch!

*🔥Must Try🔥*

** Mangalore Buns was just sweet final to the meal but the dip was not so good but the bun was Waaahhhh 😍😍 **

text.text: We had their idli, thattu idli, butter special dosai and vadai. The food was really amazing, feels like eating in banglore though. They have 2 varieties of sambar, karnataka style and tamilnadu style. I feel the food is too overpriced for the size of the serving, but nevertheless a very good ambience with exceptional taste and good service. Also had their filter coffee, it costs Rs.45/-

text.text: The best Karnataka style restaurant in Chennai. All other Karnataka style restaurants don't match this taste in Chennai. Customer friendly. They remember us every time. Food is a bit costly and worth it. So try their pineapple Kesari Bath, Open Masala, Rava Idly, Vada and Rose milk. Whatever you eat end it with their filter coffee. The atmosphere is good. Morning during weekdays with a roadside view is mind relaxing.

text.text: Great food experience and excellent pastries. I really enjoyed this contemporary outlet in Chennai. Staff is customer friendly, however they need to be further trained on menu knowledge to be able to explain dishes to customers as I ordered a grilled chicken and when it came it was loaded with capsicum and I'm badly allergic to that and when I complained about it nothing was done by wait staff.

text.text: I had an amazing dining experience at Writers Cafe in Adyar! The Madras Barbeque Chicken Flammekueche was bursting with flavor and has a very thin crust with lots of chicken pieces and the Macaroni Cream Sauce Pasta was a creamy, indulgent delight. The Honey Coriander Chicken and Barbeque Chicken Wings were tender and savory, perfect for any chicken lover. The Swiss Hot Chocolate was rich and comforting, complemented perfectly by the decadent Chocolate Donut and the heavenly Death by Chocolate dessert. The ambiance was cozy, and the service was impeccable. Highly recommend this spot for a delightful culinary experience.

The ambiance was cozy, and the service was impeccable. Highly recommend this spot for a delightful culinary experience.

text.text: I’m a regular customer of writers cafe Taramani and I love the food there. Thought of trying Adyar branch once expected the same level but to my surprise it is below par. We dined there for dinner on a weekend and it is too bad experience for us. Firstly the dishes tasted like a local road side food. We tried soup, fried chicken, fish fingers, chicken wings, onion rings and bbq pizza. Only soup and pizza are slightly better and rest all we couldn’t manage to finish at least half. And secondly it is under renovation and it also caused us slight discomfort. I recommend not to visit this branch.

editorialSummary.text: Health conscious vegetarian restaurant specialising in classic dishes from across India.

text.text: It's been so long I went here in person and had food as we generally order in. Of course vegetarians love this place and the food is quite good and they have great variety. The North Indian Thali was quite nice - we had mostly north Indian food this time but all of their food is nice in general. The main problem is parking here as during peak hours, there is a lot of rush and though there is valet, it takes time. Service was good and fast

text.text:
We were there for the Onam Sadhya on the 29 th and thoroughly loved it.
Waited upon by a gentleman, who seemed like the owning family by the way he hosted, our Sadhya was a culinary delight.
There was a delectable variety of dishes and he explained each preparation and broadly what it contained.
Delicious, fulfilling and so authentic. It was a one of a kind Onam Sadhya.
For the offering, it s very reasonably priced. We chose this Sangeetha Sadhya over some give star hotel invitations we had and enjoyed it so much!
